lexUnit.name: roar.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or utter a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion, natural force, or engine

sentence.text: Here in the basement and behind Mr Pegg was Bill Joyner and his wrapping counter , beyond which roared the mighty Goss Printing Press which poured out 300 copies of the 16-page daily every minute .
The gun roared angrily again and the inoffensive family man slumped sideways against the treacherous door , minus the top of his skull , which had been blasted out through the open side window .
The shotgun bucked in his hands and roared deafeningly in the echoing space of the big entrance hall .
They shouted and roared as those whom they saw as traitors sped by .
With ovens and gas burners roaring away , it was wiltingly hot even at the dining-room end of the kitchen .
` The old lion had raged and roared in vain " concluded Bellamy .
He roared and struggled , but , she thought , much less .
At night the boiler took over , roaring and trembling until dawn .
There were waves of red faces , smiling and shiny in the lamplight , their mouths open as the men roared and sang .
She roared with pain and anger , and used her good arm to send a volley of shots in the direction of the Chelonian .
A log fire roared in the open hearth , spitting out sparks .
Sitting up , Constance roared with delight .
He roared like a wounded bull .
He wrenched at the stout panelling , roaring with fury .
The lion has roared : who will not fear ?
